subject: Management
title: Retrospectives That Work
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Retrospectives That Work.

hook.text: A team held retros every sprint but nothing ever changed. They called it retro theater.

buildup.text: A retrospective without follow-through is worse than none. It breeds cynicism.

discovery.text: Effective retros produce exactly one or two actionable changes that are tracked to completion.

twist.text: The meeting isn't the point. The improvement that happens between meetings is.

climax.text: Pick the top issue. Assign an owner. Check progress next retro. Repeat.

punchline.text: A retro without action is just a group complaint session.

quiz.question: What makes a retrospective actually effective?
options: Producing actionable changes that are tracked to completion
Discussing every issue from the past sprint in detail
Making everyone feel heard regardless of whether anything changes
